pull_request.title: Publish document types like Organisation and Topical event when assets are created
pull_request.body:
Some document types are not editioned/versioned and they need to be published immediately when the document changes. For example Organisation title change goes live immediately.

Assets are created in an asynchronous manner and therefore the Document needs to be published again when the last asset variant is saved. This allows PublishingApiPresenter to send the images to PublishingApi.

commits.message:
Publish document types like Organisation and Topical event when assets are created

Some document types are not editioned/versioned and they need to be published immediately when
the document changes. For example Organisation title change goes live immediately.

Assets are created in an asynchronous manner and therefore the Document needs to be published
again when the last asset variant is saved. This allows PublishingApiPresenter to send the images
to PublishingApi.

Co-authored-by: syed-ali-tw <syed.ali@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>

pull_request.title: 561 new document sub navigation page
pull_request.body:
Trello: [561 | Link New Document drop down in the sub navigation to new page with radio selection](https://trello.com/c/BTRbQkCR/561-link-new-document-drop-down-in-the-sub-navigation-to-new-page-with-radio-selection)

This PR creates a new view which users will be directed to when they click on the "New document" link in the navigation bar.

Changes:

- When a user makes a selection on the type of new document they would like to create they are redirected to the correct new document type.
- When there are no radio buttons selected - they are shown an error and they remain on the New document page - this is to ensure we are not influencing their selection.
- Tests coverage includes testing the users permission granting only certain users the ability to view this page, functionality re when a user selects a radio button / does not select a button the test ensures they are shown the correct new document page or an error respectively.
- This PR also includes changes to the routes file and the necessary controller implementations

Screenshot below:

This screenshot is what the user sees when they first land on the landing page:

![whitehall-admin dev gov uk_government_admin_new-document (3)](https://github.com/alphagov/whitehall/assets/138006225/153f3845-daa8-4e7c-a29d-c8139fda02bf)

---

This screenshot is what the user sees when they select Next without selecting a radio button:

![whitehall-admin dev gov uk_government_admin_new-document (4)](https://github.com/alphagov/whitehall/assets/138006225/67078cce-1266-449b-b569-ee8cf808c3e1)

⚠️ This repo is Continuously Deployed: make sure you [follow the guidance](https://docs.publishing.service.gov.uk/manual/development-pipeline.html#merge-your-own-pull-request) ⚠️

Follow [these steps](https://guides.rubyonrails.org/upgrading_ruby_on_rails.html) if you are doing a Rails upgrade.

+    {
+      value: "case-study",
+      text: "Case study",
+      bold: true,
+      hint_text: "Use this to share real examples that help users understand a process or an important" +
+        " aspect of government policy covered on GOV.UK.",
+    },
+    {
+      value: "consultation",
+      text: "Consultation",
+      bold: true,
+      hint_text: "Use this for documents requiring a collective agreement across government, and requests for people's view on a question with an outcome.",
+    },
+    {
+      value: "detailed-guide",
+      text: "Detailed guide",
+      bold: true,
+      hint_text: "Use this to tell users the steps they need to take to complete a clearly defined task. They are usually aimed at specialist or professional audiences.",
+    },
+    {
+      value: "document-collection",
+      text: "Document collection",
+      bold: true,
+      hint_text: "Use this to group related documents on a single page for a specific audience or around a specific theme.",
+    },
+    {
+      value: "fatality-notice",
+      text: "Fatality notice",
+      bold: true,
+      hint_text: "Use this to provide official confirmation of the death of a member of the armed forces while on deployment. Ministry of Defence only.",
+    },
+    {
+      value: "news-article",
+      text: "News article",
+      bold: true,
+      hint_text: "Use this for news story, press release, government response, and world news story.",
+    },
+    {
+      value: "publication",
+      text: "Publication",
+      bold: true,
+      hint_text: "Use this for standalone government documents, white papers, strategy documents, and reports.",
+    },
+    {
+      value: "speech",
+      text: "Speech",
+      bold: true,
+      hint_text: "Use this for speeches by ministers or other named spokespeople, and ministerial statements to Parliament.",
+    },
+    {
+      value: "statistical-data-set",
+      text: "Statistical data set",
+      bold: true,
+      hint_text: "Use this for data that you publish monthly or more often without analysis.",
+    },
+  ]
+%>
+
+<div class="govuk-grid-row">
+  <div class="govuk-grid-column-two-thirds">
+    <%= form_with url: admin_new_document_options_path do %>
+      <%= render "govuk_publishing_components/components/radio", {
comment.body: Hi @RodneyJohnsonGDS - the `<legend>` change is perfect, ta! Only thing is that we still need the `<% content_for :page_title, "New document" %>` line that has been removed so that the page title appears in the browser tab.

Changelog

Sourced from govuk_publishing_components's changelog.

  • Add visually hidden text to the navbar ([PR #3684](alphagov/govuk_publishing_components#3684))
  • Add data-ga4-form-no-answer-undefined to header search form ([PR #3682](alphagov/govuk_publishing_components#3682))

Bump eslint from 8.51.0 to 8.52.0

Bumps [eslint](https://github.com/eslint/eslint) from 8.51.0 to 8.52.0.
- [Release notes](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/releases)
- [Changelog](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
- [Commits](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/compare/v8.51.0...v8.52.0)

---
updated-dependencies:
- dependency-name: eslint
  dependency-type: direct:development
  update-type: version-update:semver-minor
...

Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>

Create rake task for Image Data Relationship

We want to migrate the DefaultNewsOrganisationImageData to FeaturedImageData so that we do the migration of assets before switching over to use FeaturedImageData for non legacy flow.

Co-authored-by: syed-ali-tw <syed.ali@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>

Merge pull request #8408 from alphagov/create-rake-task-for-image-data-relationship

Create rake task for Image Data Relationship

Fix db migration and version sue to missing migration script

We accidentally pushed the schema without the actual migration script so we added it back and updated the version in schema.

Merge pull request #8414 from alphagov/missing-db-migration-for-featured-image-data

Fix db migration and version sue to missing migration script

Add featured image data relationship to topical events

FeaturedImageData will now be the intermediary class managing topical event
logos. This is now consistent with the way we typically implement attachments,
as is the case with `AttachmentData` and `ImageData`.

Adding an intermediary class rather than allowing the mount_uploader to sit on the
topical event, means we are also enabling future additions of other attachment types.
With the new Asset model in place, the intermediary class is needed to distinguish
the assets by assetable id.

Future changes will bring together under the same intermediary `_Data` class all
document types that have attachments handled by the FeaturedImageUploader since
they share versions and validation rules.
Add rake task to migrate topical events

Merge pull request #8413 from alphagov/prepare-topical-event-for-featured-image-data

Prepare topical event for featured image data
Fix schema to match migrations

Merge pull request #8393 from alphagov/dependabot/npm_and_yarn/eslint-8.52.0

Bump eslint from 8.51.0 to 8.52.0

Link all pre-publication attachments to their parent document

In an earlier PR [1], we linked draft attachments to their parent
documents. However this missed a number of pre-publication states:
scheduled, submitted and rejected. This stopped CSV attachments of those
documents from being previewed.

Therefore updating the logic to link all pre-publication states, not
just draft.

1: https://github.com/alphagov/whitehall/pull/7834

Merge pull request #8417 from alphagov/fix-schema-omission

Fix schema to match migrations

Merge pull request #8418 from alphagov/update-csv-preview-rule

Link all pre-publication attachments to their parent document

Use Update Column instead of save when migrating topical event logos

This is so that Topical Event would not get unnecessarily published.

Merge pull request #8422 from alphagov/update-column-to-avoid-topical-event-publish

Use Update Column instead of save when migrating topical event logos

Always render design system layout for document collection groups views

- Turn on the display of rendering the document collection groups views with the design system layout.
- Remove unit tests for the legacy views.
- Remove feature tests for the legacy views. The old tests were testing creating a new document collection through the UI, which wasn't covered by any of the new features tests, so we've updated one of them to cover this.

Co-Authored-By: Farah Mehmood<farah.mehmood@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
Always render design system layout for document collection group membership controller

Always render design system layout for document collection group document search views

Co-Authored-By: Farah Mehmood<farah.mehmood@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>

comment.body: This still doesn't seem to be consistent to me? Happy to jump on a quick call if my comment isn't clear.

pull_request.title: 561 new document sub navigation page
pull_request.body:
Trello: [561 | Link New Document drop down in the sub navigation to new page with radio selection](https://trello.com/c/BTRbQkCR/561-link-new-document-drop-down-in-the-sub-navigation-to-new-page-with-radio-selection)

This PR creates a new view which users will be directed to when they click on the "New document" link in the navigation bar.

Changes:

- When a user makes a selection on the type of new document they would like to create they are redirected to the correct new document type.
- When there are no radio buttons selected - they are shown an error and they remain on the New document page - this is to ensure we are not influencing their selection.
- Tests coverage includes testing the users permission granting only certain users the ability to view this page, functionality re when a user selects a radio button / does not select a button the test ensures they are shown the correct new document page or an error respectively.
- This PR also includes changes to the routes file and the necessary controller implementations

Screenshot below:

This screenshot is what the user sees when they first land on the landing page:

![whitehall-admin dev gov uk_government_admin_new-document (3)](https://github.com/alphagov/whitehall/assets/138006225/153f3845-daa8-4e7c-a29d-c8139fda02bf)

---

This screenshot is what the user sees when they select Next without selecting a radio button:

![whitehall-admin dev gov uk_government_admin_new-document (4)](https://github.com/alphagov/whitehall/assets/138006225/67078cce-1266-449b-b569-ee8cf808c3e1)

⚠️ This repo is Continuously Deployed: make sure you [follow the guidance](https://docs.publishing.service.gov.uk/manual/development-pipeline.html#merge-your-own-pull-request) ⚠️

Follow [these steps](https://guides.rubyonrails.org/upgrading_ruby_on_rails.html) if you are doing a Rails upgrade.
